New Records: The Chicago White Sox are tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record for losses in a season with 120 losses
Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi's 10th-inning single helped the White Sox avoid a record-breaking 121st loss
Korey Lee gave the White Sox a 2-0 lead with a two-run homer in the second
Lenyn Sosa put Chicago back on top with a tiebreaking solo drive in the fourth
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox are trying to avoid the record for most losses in a season
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore said, 'We're not going to let anything rattle us. We're going out there and trying to compete and do the best we can to get a win'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels matched a franchise record with their 95th loss
Others: The White Sox will play Los Angeles again on Thursday before finishing their schedule with three games at Detroit
